info.senderName: NWS Lubbock (Lubbock and South Plains Texas)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued April 02 at 8:58PM CDT until April 05 at 4:00AM CDT by NWS Lubbock
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM MONDAY TO 4 AM CDT WEDNESDAY FOR STRONG WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR THE FAR SOUTHERN TEXAS PANHANDLE, THE SOUTH PLAINS, AND THE ROLLING PLAINS... ...RED FLAG WARNING FOR TODAY IS CANCELLED FOR STRONG WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR THE FAR SOUTHWESTERN AND SOUTH-CENTRAL TEXAS PANHANDLE AND THE SOUTH PLAINS... The National Weather Service in Lubbock has cancelled the Red Flag Warning for today. The National Weather Service in Lubbock has issued a Red Flag Warning, which is in effect from 11 AM Monday to 4 AM CDT Wednesday. The Fire Weather Watch is no longer in effect. * Timing...11 AM Monday until 4 AM CDT on Wednesday. There may be a few hours break in fire weather concerns late Monday night into early Tuesday morning. * Wind...Westerly 20 to 30 mph on Monday and 35 to 50 mph on Tuesday with gusts near 70 mph. * Humidity...As low as 4 percent on Monday and as low as 6 percent on Tuesday. * Fuels...Extremely dry on Monday and Tuesday. * Impacts...Any fires that develop can spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is discouraged.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.
